data.content: Be patient, for Allah is with those who wait.
data.author: Anonymous

data.content: Perhaps something awaits you that is more beloved to you than what you lost.
data.author: Anonymous

data.content: Nothing is difficult except for God to make it easy for you.
data.author: Anonymous

data.content: Be optimistic, for good is coming, God willing.
data.author: Anonymous

data.content: God will not let down a heart that expects good from Him.
data.author: Anonymous

data.content: Do not worry, for provisions are in God's hands.
data.author: Anonymous

data.content: Do not be sad, for with hardship comes ease.
data.author: Anonymous

data.content: Do not despair, for God is with you.
data.author: Anonymous

data.content: I realised that what I loved wasn't a person, but an image.
data.author: Anonymous

data.content: I desire nothing more than a deep, restful sleep.
data.author: Anonymous

data.content: I want her to choose me.
data.author: Anonymous

data.content: With every sunrise, dreams are renewed, and a July morning brings with it the warmth of beginnings and a new opportunity to write more beautiful chapters, as light floods everything that was drowned in the darkness of yesterday, whispering to us that life always moves forward.
data.author: Anonymous

data.content: Perhaps I wish for you, and I know for certain that you will not become mine, my love and my comfort are a mistake, and I fear for you from being disfigured, be safe in an innocent world that looks at you with purity, not with me.
data.author: Anonymous

data.content: And if you seek me, I will stay by your side and watch you happy by watching the star that resembles you and by my constant prayers to our Lord, who I know will answer my prayers to keep you happy.
data.author: Anonymous

data.content: The night gets longer and the reproach gets longer until you fall asleep with a shrunken body and a heavy burden, hoping to wake up in a world where you are what you wish for someone.
data.author: Anonymous

data.content: How long will I remain stuck with my mind that contains my emotional states as stages to overcome my heart that has turned into a blood pump throughout my body?
data.author: Anonymous

data.content: And in the stillness that precedes sleep, and in the crowd that does not resemble you, I miss you when my mind thinks of what you would have said if you were here.
data.author: Anonymous

data.content: My heart burns with longing for you, and my eyes tear from the depths. Longing burns me, and tears drown me. Have you ever seen a drowning person burning?
data.author: Anonymous

data.content: 'You are not to be mine, but I love you. I still love you. My yearning for you is killing me. My pride is inhibiting me, and eveything is standing between me and you!
data.author: Anonymous

data.content: If you really want something that you can't actually have, and you keep it right in front of you, then it's gonna be harder for you to want anything else at all.
data.author: Anonymous

data.content: All of us are selective sinners. We choose the sins we are comfortable with, and judge others that commit the ones that we are not comfortable with.
data.author: Anonymous

data.content: If she asked me "what is the difference between  me and the sky?" I'd say, "The difference, my love, is that when you laugh, I forget about the sky.
data.author: Anonymous

data.content: When you disappear from me in my dreams, I see you in my heart. When you disappear from my heart, you show your presence in my vision.
data.author: Anonymous

data.content: And if what unites us is nonexistent and has no existence, and is merely an illusion, I will stay here watching the clouds and singing to you.
data.author: Anonymous

data.content: And when I read words that remind me of you, and when my pride fails me, I whisper your name to myself. Not to remember, to comfort.
data.author: Anonymous

data.content: To remain stuck between staying and leaving, between continuing and stopping, stuck in the middle; emulates a pain that is proprietary.
data.author: Anonymous

data.content: I loved you, and I lost myself in the colour of your eyes, then I found myself in the deceit of your eyes, then I hated you.
data.author: Anonymous

data.content: If I had known that the dream would bring us together, I would have kept my eyelids closed shut for the rest of my life.
data.author: Anonymous

data.content: I have done nothing all summer but wait for myself to be myself again.
data.author: Anonymous
data.source: Georgia O'Keeffe to Russel Vernon Hunter

data.content: There’s nothing in this world that will destroy you faster than you unable to forgive yourself for your wrong doings.
data.author: Anonymous

data.content: The irony of fate makes you cry when you turn from a person who chose isolation to a lonely, abandoned person.
data.author: Anonymous

data.content: There were moments of love, closeness, attachment. But there was no clarity, no commitment, not many words.
data.author: Anonymous

data.content: I loved you in a very specific way. In a way that was not fair to me, nor to you, nor even to life that separated us.
data.author: Anonymous

data.content: The past passes like the waves of the sea, leaving its traces on the sands of memory, but never returning.
data.author: Anonymous

data.content: My love for you will remain intact for the rest of the time, because you are dearer to me than my existence.
data.author: Anonymous

data.content: And if I turn away from you, I will cry for all the dead one day, perhaps one day you will be among them.
data.author: Anonymous

data.content: O inhabitant of the heart, never leave its corners, for you revive it with your closeness to its pulse.
data.author: Anonymous

data.content: My drink of your affection was pure, while my drink of the water of the Euphrates was a mirage.
data.author: Anonymous

data.content: If you had any doubt that I would forget you tomorrow, tell me, can a rose forget its waterer?
data.author: Anonymous

data.content: You departed from my sight, and entered my thoughts. Travelled from my eyes, to my heart.
data.author: Anonymous

data.content: The problem is that you're unconsciously holding onto the very thing you're trying to let go.
data.author: Anonymous

data.content: I love you with a love that, if you felt the same, it would drive you mad with longing for me.
data.author: Anonymous

data.content: And in a secluded part of my heart, there is a city; a city where you are its only population.
data.author: Anonymous

data.content: Life is not measured by time, it is measured by moments. Some are big, most are small.
data.author: Anonymous

data.content: I can get every other thing wrong in life, but you are the one thing that I hope I get right.
data.author: Anonymous

data.content: Overhit your pass, and you'll lose the ball. Underhit it, the opponent will counterattack.
data.author: Anonymous

data.content: I'm still stuck on you, so tell me, how do I learn not to miss something that hurts me?
data.author: Anonymous

data.content: And if it is destined for us to meet, I can be certain that I will love you at first sight.
data.author: Anonymous

data.content: The more often you cry, the quicker you realize that crying never solves anything.
data.author: Anonymous

data.content: From chaos comes order. Not everything that is intense has to be for the worse.
data.author: Anonymous

data.content: You weren't like those who pass by my eyes, I see you dwelling deep within me.
data.author: Anonymous

data.content: Sunsets are proof that no matter what happens, everyday can end beautifully.
data.author: Anonymous

data.content: My heart misses you in dark moonlit nights as if its only purpose was to do so.
data.author: Anonymous

data.content: Your wounds will only heal if you stop poking at them to verify if they still hurt.
data.author: Anonymous

data.content: He wanted to live, she wanted to die, so she lived for him and he died for her.
data.author: Anonymous

data.content: My heart loves yours so much and it knows it. What's wrong with your heart?
data.author: Anonymous

data.content: Having to learn how to live without you is a lesson I never wanted to learn.
data.author: Anonymous

data.content: You fall in love with the idea of someone you've never met, not the person.
data.author: Anonymous

data.content: Eye contact is a dangerous, dangerous thing. But lovely. Oh, so lovely.
data.author: Anonymous

data.content: The disease of longing has no cure except for eyes to look into eyes.
data.author: Anonymous

data.content: Everyone sleeps but lovers, they stay awake telling stories to God.
data.author: Anonymous

data.content: Better starve than eat whatever, better be alone than with whoever.
data.author: Anonymous

data.content: How could you wish for heaven when all you've ever known is hell?
data.author: Anonymous

data.content: Though a righteous man may fall seven times, he stands up eight.
data.author: Anonymous

data.content: It's only with the heart that one can see clearly what's essential.
data.author: Anonymous

data.content: A well-fed person forgets the taste of hunger, until love leaves.
data.author: Anonymous

data.content: And still, I stayed, hoping you'd notice the way I looked at you.
data.author: Anonymous

data.content: I loved you in a way that I could not find an explanation for.
data.author: Anonymous

data.content: What recourse does the needy have but their imagination?
data.author: Anonymous

data.content: It was excessively calm, but a calm that precedes loss.
data.author: Anonymous

data.content: Art means happy and beautiful things that touch you.
data.author: Anonymous

data.content: My longing for you has never ended, nor has my love.
data.author: Anonymous

data.content: Do you know what turns darkness into light? Poetry.
data.author: Anonymous

data.content: Objects in mirror are closer than they appear.
data.author: Anonymous

data.content: And I miss you like the deserts miss the rain
data.author: Anonymous

data.content: Hearts may forgive, but they never forget.
data.author: Anonymous

data.content: There's freedom in the act of letting go.
data.author: Anonymous

data.content: O lady of my heart, O beauty of beauty.
data.author: Anonymous

data.content: You are my illness and my cure.
data.author: Anonymous

data.content: I think the saddest people always try their hardest to make people happy because they know what it’s like to feel absolutely worthless and they don’t want anyone else to feel like that.
data.author: Robin Williams

data.content: It's unfortunate, and I really wish I wouldn't have to say this, but I really like human beings who have suffered. They're kinder.
data.author: Emma Thompson

data.content: You will burn and you will burn out; you will be healed and come back again.
data.author: Fyodor Dostoevsky

data.content: Drunk on myself, on music, on poems, why didn't I speak of absence's void.
data.author: Alejandra Pizarnik

data.content: There is nothing so cruel as the desolation of having nothing to hope for.
data.author: Haruki Murakami

data.content: When a person tells you you hurt them, you don't get to decide you didn't.
data.author: Louis C.K.

data.content: I want to write a novel about silence. The things people don't say.
data.author: Virginia Woolf

data.content: I have nothing in the world except your eyes and my sorrows.
data.author: Nizar Qabbani

data.content: What if I told you I'm incapable of tolerating my own heart?
data.author: Virginia Woolf

data.content: I have so much love in me that I would like to cry.;
data.author: Simone de Beauvoir

data.content: You were destined for me. Perhaps as a punishment.
data.author: Fyodor Dostoevsky

data.content: The innocent and the beautiful / Have no enemy but time.
data.author: W.B. Yeats

data.content: Remembering is only a new form of suffering.
data.author: Charles Baudelaire

data.content: I long for you, so teach me, how not to long.
data.author: Mahmoud Darwish

data.content: I lean to you, numb as a fossil. Tell me I'm here.
data.author: Sylvia Plath

data.content: You cannot be wise & in love at the same time.
data.author: Bob Dylan

data.content: I have a new plan; to go mad.
data.author: Fyodor Dostoevsky

data.content: Love is all I am, and all I know.
data.author: Khalil Gibran

data.content: Touch has a memory.
data.author: John Keats

data.content: Our love was a star that collapsed, and I am now just a planet caught in its dead orbit, circling a beautiful, cold nothingness where a universe used to burn.
data.author: Anonymous

data.content: My heart did not ask my permission to break, and my eyes do not ask before they weep; my own body has become a traitor, loyal only to the memory of you.
data.author: Anonymous

data.content: I can no longer walk by the river, for the water does not reflect the sky, but the memory of your face, turning a simple landscape into a sacred and terrible tomb.
data.author: Anonymous

data.content: Your coffee cup still in the sink doesn't just hold the faint stain of your lipstick; it holds the entire gravity of our last morning, and my hand trembles to lift it.
data.author: Anonymous

data.content: The most violent part of the day is when your name forms on the edge of my tongue in casual conversation, a word I must suddenly swallow like a shard of glass.
data.author: Anonymous

data.content: They never tell you that heartbreak is a thief that steals songs, turning melodies that once built a home for you into rooms you can no longer enter.
data.author: Anonymous

data.content: My arm still remembers the specific weight of your head, and at night, it aches with the phantom pressure of a love that is no longer there.
data.author: Anonymous

data.content: Hurt people, hurt people.
data.author: Anonymous

data.content: Let whoever, think whatever.
data.author: Anonymous

data.content: See everything, say nothing.
data.author: Anonymous

data.content: We mature from damage, not age.
data.author: Anonymous

data.content: Silent treatment goes both ways.
data.author: Anonymous

data.content: It's better to wait than to find.
data.author: Anonymous

data.content: You can't miss what was never yours.
data.author: Anonymous

data.content: Rain remembers what the sun forgets.
data.author: Anonymous

data.content: Beauty isn't found, it is recognized.
data.author: Anonymous

data.content: Slow motion is better than no motion.
data.author: Anonymous

data.content: Show no love. Love will get you killed.
data.author: Anonymous

data.content: Museum of failure or gallery of trying?
data.author: Anonymous

data.content: You can't be brave if you're not afraid.
data.author: Anonymous

data.content: He lives the poetry that he cannot write.
data.author: Anonymous

data.content: Hurting them back will not heal your pain.
data.author: Anonymous

data.content: What is to give light must endure burning.
data.author: Anonymous

data.content: What if time is love unfolding in disguise?
data.author: Anonymous

data.content: Nothing kills you faster than your own mind.
data.author: Anonymous

data.content: We belong to God and to Him we shall return.
data.author: Anonymous

data.content: You left so soon, I wasn't done loving you yet.
data.author: Anonymous

data.content: Beautiful souls are shaped by ugly experiences.
data.author: Anonymous

data.content: As long as you have yourself, you have someone.
data.author: Anonymous

data.content: For you are dust and to the dust You shall return.
data.author: Anonymous

data.content: You will always be the biggest threat to yourself.
data.author: Anonymous

data.content: Do not get attached to anything you found on Earth.
data.author: Anonymous

data.content: One's direction is more important than their speed.
data.author: Anonymous

data.content: Falling in love should never be part of one's plan.
data.author: Anonymous

data.content: Just as to bleed is to be alive, to love is to hurt.
data.author: Anonymous

data.content: You were the rain I danced in, unaware I was drowning.
data.author: Anonymous

data.content: How do you forget the one you cried in prayers to have?
data.author: Anonymous

data.content: The storms in my head ruin the garden that my soul holds.
data.author: Anonymous

data.content: God will never let what you lost be the best you ever had.
data.author: Anonymous

data.content: Between life and death, lies an unexplainably calm silence.
data.author: Anonymous

data.content: I wish I wasn't slowly forgetting the way your voice sounds.
data.author: Anonymous

data.content: Who am I to judge another when my own soul is full of scars.
data.author: Anonymous

data.content: May the calm within you win over the chaos that surrounds you.
data.author: Anonymous

data.content: There is a crack in everything, that is how the light gets in.
data.author: Anonymous

data.content: Your name still tastes sweet, but I've lost the hunger for it.
data.author: Anonymous

data.content: We are not real until we ache for something that never existed.
data.author: Anonymous

data.content: In reality, I never got better. I only got better at masking it.
data.author: Anonymous

data.content: You can't heal if you keep holding what burns right through you.
data.author: Anonymous

data.content: Hearts can be wild creatures. Maybe that's why our ribs are cages.
data.author: Anonymous

data.content: Life and love isn't about what you gain, it's about what you give.
data.author: Anonymous

data.content: Close the window that hurts you, no matter how beautiful the view.
data.author: Anonymous

data.content: But how do you run away from the things that are inside your head?
data.author: Anonymous

data.content: There's grief, and then the grief of a life you didn't get to live.
data.author: Anonymous

data.content: Be gentle with yourself, even growing feels like breaking at first.
data.author: Anonymous

data.content: If I ever saw a flaw of yours, I'd say my eyes are the flawed ones.
data.author: Anonymous

data.content: If you fixed all of your mistakes, would you really be you anymore?
data.author: Anonymous

data.content: A person born in a burning house believes that the world is on fire.
data.author: Anonymous

data.content: A fool prays for an easier road, a wise man prays for stronger legs.
data.author: Anonymous

data.content: Peace is found not in perfection, but in the acceptance of imperfection.
data.author: Anonymous

data.content: A child who has spent his life in darkness will find no solace in light.
data.author: Anonymous

data.content: I wrote so much about you, my pen wonders what your existence truly holds.
data.author: Anonymous

data.content: It only hurts more knowing all the things you do is never targeted for me.
data.author: Anonymous

data.content: Peace isn't about control, it's about surrendering to what you can't change.
data.author: Anonymous

data.content: Even a correct decision transforms to a wrong one when it's applied too late.
data.author: Anonymous

data.content: Always pity the overthinkers, for they are cursed with their own imagination.
data.author: Anonymous

data.content: Maybe the happy ending is you continuing to be the soft loving person you are.
data.author: Anonymous

data.content: In order to love who you are, you cannot hate the experiences that shaped you.
data.author: Anonymous

data.content: The path doesn't appear before the walk, it appears because of it. Keep moving.
data.author: Anonymous

data.content: How silly of me to forget how far I've come just because I still have far to go.
data.author: Anonymous

data.content: If you are an ocean, be an ocean. Don't be a pond just because people can't swim.
data.author: Anonymous

data.content: You are so invested in how you are perceived, that you cannot fully enjoy living.
data.author: Anonymous

data.content: Every time we translate our chaos into calm, we lost a little more of who we were.
data.author: Anonymous

data.content: Somewhere beyond right and wrong, there is a garden, I will meet you there.
data.author: Rumi

data.content: There comes a time when nothing is meaningful except surrendering to love.
data.author: Rumi

data.content: I was a candle, you were the night. I burned for you, while you waited for the sun.
data.author: Anonymous

data.content: They say rain heals, but how can it heal a wound that's never been allowed to bleed?
data.author: Anonymous

data.content: For those who love with heart and soul, there is no such thing as separation
data.author: Rumi

data.content: And I just wanna find myself in the middle of you
data.author: Ax And The Hachetmen

data.content: To be liked by others is a fleeting thing, to understand oneself is the greater task.
data.author: Anonymous

data.content: Let them call you difficult, the ocean never apologised for its depth. Why should you?
data.author: Anonymous

data.content: Time is a moving object and it will not pay attention to any fragile heart in existence.
data.author: Anonymous

data.content: The darker the night the brighter the stars, so the deeper the grief the closer is God.
data.author: Anonymous

data.content: I hope you never stop visiting me in my dreams because now that's all I have left of you.
data.author: Anonymous

data.content: Don’t talk to them about loss, where were they when I was at my lowest, completely alone?
data.author: Anonymous

data.content: To even picture one's dream coming true, one's ambition must be as boundless as the ocean.
data.author: Anonymous

data.content: Don't stress over things you can't control, you'll end up exhausted and lose sense of time.
data.author: Anonymous

data.content: People pretend you’re a bad person so they don’t feel guilty about the things they did to you.
data.author: Anonymous

data.content: When a clown moves into a palace, he doesn't become a king. The palace itself becomes a circus.
data.author: Anonymous

data.content: And soon, there will come a time where my eyes shall recognise you, but my heart no longer will.
data.author: Anonymous

data.content: The magic in our childhood wasn't because of being a child, it was because we lived in the present.
data.author: Anonymous

data.content: How could I be mad at the stove for burning my hand when I'm the one who reached out and touched it.
data.author: Anonymous

data.content: How fragile we are that the things keeping us alive can kill us too-water, heat, a conscious, love.
data.author: Anonymous

data.content: You are so ingrained in my skin that anyone who tries to know me will have to know your name first.
data.author: Anonymous

data.content: Having God in your boat doesn't mean you won't face any storms, it means no storm can sink your boat.
data.author: Anonymous

data.content: When you planted flowers in the graveyard of my heart, I thought you would be there to water them too.
data.author: Anonymous

data.content: The worst part about missing you was that I didn't know if I was allowed to-you were never really mine.
data.author: Anonymous

data.content: ’Tis better to face an enemy who hates you openly than a friend who hides it and speaks behind your back.
data.author: Anonymous

data.content: They say poetry is beautiful but pain was never meant to be beautiful and blood was never meant to be ink.
data.author: Anonymous

data.content: You walked in, and every clock how to tick. I've seen beauty before, but never something that paused time.
data.author: Anonymous

data.content: Identity isn’t what stays. It’s what keeps returning despite the many attempts of others bringing it down.
data.author: Anonymous

data.content: Death is not the greatest loss in life, The greatest loss is what dies inside us while we are still alive.
data.author: Anonymous

data.content: And as the final act of my love for you, I'll let go, even though every atom that forms me wants to hold on.
data.author: Anonymous

data.content: After you, I won't seek love again, because I know if I do I'll be searching pieces of you in everyone I meet.
data.author: Anonymous

data.content: If a flower bloomed in the wrong season, would you call it a failure or a miracle?
data.author: Anonymous

data.content: Be kind to your own timing.
data.author: Anonymous

data.content: If the rain that touches your skin traveled miles to find you, then so will everything that's written in your name.
data.author: Anonymous

data.content: I was naive and hopeful and lost, now I'm aware and trapped in my thoughts.
data.author: The Neighbourhood

data.content: With just one glimpse of her unmatched beauty, it shattered; whatever inside me had only pretended to heal with time.
data.author: Anonymous

data.content: The land everybody is being negligent towards as of today, will become the land that holds control of everything one day.
data.author: Anonymous

data.content: Love death as much as you love life, for only the worst and utmost disgusting characters should fear the afterlife itself.
data.author: Anonymous

data.content: 'The rearview mirror is meant for glancing, not staring'- So use it when you need to, but don't let your eyes reside in it.
data.author: Anonymous

data.content: Whoever abandoned you in the middle of the ocean has no right to know what the sharks did to you or how you managed it to the shore.
data.author: Anonymous

data.content: Days will pass, and you'll abandon things you were addicted to, and leave someone, and cancel a dream, and finally, accept a reality.
data.author: Anonymous

data.content: They say fate turns countless times for two souls to meet once, and if you miss the moment, it slips away with all that life had to offer.
data.author: Anonymous

data.content: Be disciplined, loyal, dependable, and true to your word, as success isn't found in your job, It is found in the man you choose to become.
data.author: Anonymous

data.content: If all the poetry that includes our painful statements could bleed, the world would be stained with all the world that failed to escape from our mouths.
data.author: Anonymous

data.content: You only notice the holes in the roof when it starts to rain, so conceal the holes in the roof before you suffer from the water that silently invades your home.
data.author: Anonymous

data.content: Everything about me is black. Except for the centre of my heart where I've kept you. It glows blood red at all times, and sport green when it is in front of you.
data.author: Anonymous

data.content: First it hurts, then it changes you.
data.author: Tony Montana

data.content: They can't see what I see in you.
data.author: Gaspard

data.content: We all make mistakes and we all pay a price.
data.author: Dr. Gregory House

data.content: The world's just really fuckin' ugly, you know?
data.author: Rue Bennett

data.content: Oh, wow! I have no words to describe your beauty!
data.author: Anonymous

data.content: To feel. To trust the feeling. I long for that.
data.author: Dr. Jenny Isaksson

data.content: Why do fireflies have to die so soon?
data.author: Setsuko

data.content: Nature is a mirror in which we can study ourselves.
data.author: Hossain Sabzian

data.content: Nobody feels sorry for you and nobody ever will.
data.author: Wilson Fisk

data.content: And the more people I cut out, the quieter my life got.
data.author: Carmen 'Carmy' Berzatto

data.content: When you leave something behind, you gain something too.
data.author: Nora

data.content: I don't know much, but the innocent don't control this world.
data.author: Carmen

data.content: Not all the people who are nice to you has good intentions.
data.author: Coraline Jones

data.content: I'm journeying into darkness anyhow, so I really don't care.
data.author: Lemmy Caution

data.content: What cannot be forgotten... reappears in dreams.
data.author: Anonymous

data.content: I will return, find you, love you, marry you. And live without shame.
data.author: Robbie Turner

data.content: Seems like there's something missing in me that the rest of the world has.
data.author: Pearl

data.content: It's only after we've lost everything that we're free to do anything.
data.author: Tyler Durden

data.content: We have so much to say, and we shall never say it.
data.author: Paul Bäumer
data.source: All Quiet On The Western Front (2022)

data.content: You have to decide what kind of man you want to grow up to be, Clark.
data.author: Jonathan Kent

data.content: You don't have to know someone to feel sad for them. It's empathy.
data.author: Johnny

data.content: There are still a lot of things I don't understand. That's how life goes.
data.author: Hirayama

data.content: I've been doin' a lot of thinkin', and the thing is, I love you.
data.author: Harry Burns

data.content: People's superficial aspects don't interest me, the deeper ones do.
data.author: Marion

data.content: You don't always have to be who they want you to be, you know?
data.author: Patrick Verona

data.content: There are monsters who act like people, and people who act like monsters.
data.author: Mr. Okuyama

data.content: You never wanted to be anybody's girlfriend and now you're somebody's wife.
data.author: Tom Hansen

data.content: He's your first love. I intend to be your last.. however long it takes.
data.author: Klaus Mikaelson

data.content: I just woke up one day and knew. Knew what? What I was never sure of with you.
data.author: Summer Finn

data.content: Trust me, Peter, when you try to fix people, there are always consequences.
data.author: Dr. Strange

data.content: But it's no good if there isn't somebody you can turn to and say, "Nice view, huh?"
data.author: Jeff Bailey

data.content: No matter how much you change... you still have to pay the price for the things you've done.
data.author: Doug MacRay

data.content: Listen kid, nobody cares. Worry about yourself, your family and the people who are important to you.
data.author: Sonny LoSpecchio

data.content: Deep rivers run quiet.
data.author: Haruki Murakami

data.content: She needed someone already grown.
data.author: Franz Kafka

data.content: He who is brave is free.
data.author: Lucius Annaeus Seneca

data.content: I wanted her to grow with me.
data.author: Fyodor Dostoevsky

data.content: Leave me to my own absurdity.
data.author: Sophocles

data.content: He who dares not offend cannot be honest.
data.author: Thomas Paine

data.content: come back, come back to me
data.author: Ian McEwan

data.content: Dearest, accept me as I am.
data.author: Franz Kafka

data.content: No two people can know the sea the same way.
data.author: Mahmoud Darwish

data.content: I am too young and I've loved you too much.
data.author: Fyodor Dostoevsky

data.content: I did violence to my own heart
data.author: Edgar Allan Poe

data.content: I ran from love because I knew it would destroy me.
data.author: Franz Kafka

data.content: I crave a love so deep, the ocean would be jealous.
data.author: Pablo Neruda

data.content: As for myself, I had a lot to say. But I was silent.
data.author: Albert Camus

data.content: We do not see things as they are, we see them as we are.
data.author: Anais Nin

data.content: Your hand is cold, mine burns like fire. How blind you are, Nastenka!
data.author: Fyodor Dostoevsky

data.content: Forgive me, memory is a rope around the neck.
data.author: Clementine von Radics

data.content: And what I really intended to say in the end remains unsaid.
data.author: Franz Kafka

data.content: Darling, the moon is still the moon in all of its phases.
data.author: Isra Al-Thibeh

data.content: I am the sea and nobody owns me.
data.author: Pippi Longstocking

data.content: Of all the ways to lose a person, Death is the kindest.
data.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

data.content: Time was a wave, almost cruel in its relentlessness
data.author: Han Kang

data.content: I haven't yet tasted everything that can keep me alive.
data.author: Albert Camus

data.content: If it is humanly possible, consider it to be within your reach.
data.author: Marcus Aurelius

data.content: It's been a long time since I've been me.
data.author: Fernando Pessoa

data.content: If pain can purify the heart, mine will be pure.
data.author: Mary Shelley

data.content: My brain hums with scraps of poetry and madness.
data.author: Virginia Woolf

data.content: I ran into love because I needed it to destroy who I used to be.
data.author: Fyodor Dostoevsky

data.content: I hid my pain even from myself; I revealed my pain only to myself.
data.author: Agha Shahid Ali

data.content: Everything you say should be true, but not everything true should be said.
data.author: Voltaire

data.content: All I ever wanted was to know what to do.
data.author: Dave Eggers

data.content: To live is the rarest thing in the world. Most people exist, that is all.
data.author: Oscar Wilde

data.content: But the heart has its own memory and I have forgotten nothing.
data.author: Albert Camus

data.content: There are times when I am convinced I am unfit for any human relationship.
data.author: Franz Kafka

data.content: The greatest thing you'll ever learn is just to love and be loved in return.
data.author: Eden Ahbez

data.content: How about if I sleep a little bit longer and forget about all this nonsense.
data.author: Franz Kafka

data.content: The world is a tragedy to those who feel, but a comedy to those who think.
data.author: Horace Walpole

data.content: Out of love for you, I have forgiven the world.
data.author: Alexandre Dumas

data.content: People who bite the hand that feeds them usually lick the boot that kicks them.
data.author: Eric Hoffer

data.content: A leaf does not cease to be a leaf merely because a storm tore it from the tree.
data.author: Paulo Coelho

data.content: Your worst sin is that you have destroyed and betrayed yourself for nothing.
data.author: Fyodor Dostoevsky

data.content: I look forward and see myself look back.
data.author: Erica Jong

data.content: But to fall in love does not mean to love. One can fall in love and still hate.
data.author: Fyodor Dostoevsky

data.content: I want to talk about everything with at least one person as I would with myself.
data.author: Fyodor Dostoevsky

data.content: If you feel pain, you're alive. If you feel other people's pain, you're a human being.
data.author: Leo Tolstoy

data.content: There must be something strangely sacred in salt. It is in our tears and in the sea.
data.author: Khalil Gibran

data.content: Maybe all one can do is hope to end with the right regrets.
data.author: Arthur Miller

data.content: Pain and suffering are always inevitable for a large intelligence and a deep heart.
data.author: Fyodor Dostoevsky

data.content: Dead people receive more flowers than the living because regret is stronger than gratitude.
data.author: Anne Frank

data.content: I'm not upset that you lied to me, I'm upset that from now on I can't believe you.
data.author: Friedrich Nietzsche

data.content: It is better to be unhappy and know the worst, than to be happy in a fool's paradise.
data.author: Fyodor Dostoevsky

data.content: I am both worse and better than you thought.
data.author: Sylvia Plath
data.source: The Unabridged Journals of Sylvia Plath

data.content: Despite this feeling of time standing still, I had in fact changed.
data.author: Margaret Atwood

data.content: And in the silence I suddenly understood the many ways a person can die but still be alive.
data.author: Carmen Rodrigues

data.content: A person is, among all else, a material thing, easily torn and not easily mended.
data.author: Ian McEwan

data.content: Everything you love is very likely to be lost, but in the end, love will return in a different way.
data.author: Franz Kafka

data.content: If the book we read does not wake us, as with a fist hammering on our skull, why then do we read it?
data.author: Franz Kafka

data.content: And that's the thing about people who mean everything they say. They think everyone else does too.
data.author: Khaled Hosseini

data.content: Sometimes people don't want to hear the truth, because they don't want their illusions destroyed.
data.author: Friedrich Nietzsche

data.content: You will never know who I am in reality because the depth of existence exceeds the limit of understanding.
data.author: Taha Zainab

data.content: I don't feel particularly proud of myself. But when I walk alone in the woods or lie in the meadows, all is well.
data.author: Franz Kafka

data.content: Most of our childhood is stored not in photos, but in certain biscuits, lights of day, smells, textures of carpet.
data.author: Alain de Botton

data.content: I am tired. These people make me feel I have a hole in the middle of me.
data.author: D.H. Lawrence
data.source: The Complete Works; The Plumbed Serpent

data.content: People do not see you, They invent you and accuse you.
data.author: Helene Cixous
data.source: The Selected Plays of Helene Cixous; "The Perjured City,"

data.content: People label themselves with all sorts of adjectives. I can only pronounce myself as "nauseatingly miserable beyond repair".
data.author: Franz Kafka

data.content: Sadness is caused by intelligence, the more you understand certain things, the more you wish you didn't understand them.
data.author: Charles Bukowski

data.content: Everyone seems to have a clear idea of how other people should lead their lives, but none about his or he own.
data.author: Paulo Coelho

data.content: I wanted to cry out, to ask her not to go. But what right I had to hold her back when her happiness lay in another's arms?
data.author: Fyodor Dostoevsky

data.content: When it's gone, you'll know what a gift love was. You'll suffer like this. So go back and fight to keep it.
data.author: Ian McEwan

data.content: I've never had a moment's doubt. I love you. I believe in you completely. You are my dearest one. My reason for life.
data.author: Ian McEwan

data.content: You cannot make everyone think and feel as deeply as you do. this is your tragedy, because you understand them but they don't understand you.
data.author: Daniel Saint

data.content: Talk nonsense, but talk your own nonsense, and I'll kiss you for it. To go wrong in one's own way is better to go right in someone else's.
data.author: Fyodor Dostoevsky

data.content: I am a fool with a heart but no brains, and you are a fool with brains but no heart; and we're both unhappy, and we both suffer.
data.author: Fyodor Dostoevsky

data.content: My God, my God, whose performance am I watching? How many people am I? Who am I? What is this space between myself and myself?
data.author: Fernando Pessoa

data.content: I wouldn't let you know, but even if all the rains in the world drown me, I would still choose to refuse a sunny day if it was you, who offered it.
data.author: Anonymous

data.content: Every soul shall taste death.
data.author: Quran

data.content: Oh my Lord! I am face to face the favor you will shower upon me.
data.author: Quran

data.content: You liars! If Allah were to throw the stones through my window, he would not miss.
data.author: Uthmaan RA

data.content:
"Lost"

They say you can't lose what was never yours,
but love, for a moment, opened its doors.
She was mine in a glance, in a breath, in a flame,
But now only the silence remembers her name.
data.author: Fatin

data.content:
"Something"

we were almost something.
not quite lovers, not just friends—just two people standing at the edge of a maybe.
there were glances that lingered a second too long.
silences that said more than our words ever dared.
you held my gaze like it meant something.
i held my breath like it could change everything.
but we never stepped forward.
maybe out of fear.
maybe out of timing.
maybe because we both knew,
almost is safer than heartbreak.
still, sometimes i wonder what we could’ve been, if “almost” had dared to become more.
data.author: Fatin

data.content:
"Almost"

We were almost, but not quite
a spark lost in the endless night.
Not lovers, not quite friends,
just me hoping the story bends.
Your words were light, a gentle breeze,
but never meant to bring me ease.
You held my gaze, or so I'd thought-
while I caught feelings you never sought.
I stayed awake on silent screens,
chasing shadows, chasing dreams.
We never touched, not hand or heart,
yet still it tore me all apart.
Maybe you never saw me there,
maybe you simply didn’t care.
Almost hurt me, but I stayed—
clinging to what you never gave.
Now I watch you drift away,
a ghost I loved, who couldn’t stay.
And wonder still, as nights grow long,
what’s left of me in your silent song?
data.author: Fatin

data.content:
"Coffee"

the coffee didn’t fix me,
but it stayed warm
long enough
for me to breathe again.
no deep thoughts this time,
just the hum of the machine
and the way silence
sometimes says more
than advice ever could.
i sat there,
half-sinking into my own weight,
watching steam curl like
a tired exhale —
gentle,
but still here.
i didn’t cry.
didn’t smile, either.
i just existed,
and that was enough
for now.
some days,
healing doesn’t look like a breakthrough.
it looks like not pouring the cup down the sink.
it looks like showing up,
even if you’re quiet about it.
and the coffee?
still warm.
so maybe i’m not too far gone.
data.author: Fatin

data.content:
"Almost Known"

Beneath the weight of rolling years,
I stood two steps behind her fears.
A stranger caught in a glowing screen,
where shadows melted into night’s sheen.
She came from places I’d not known,
a world beyond my sheltered zone.
Her words at first, a distant song,
yet slowly, they would pull me strong.
She held her truth, steady, kind,
her place was right, though worlds aligned
in different beats within one heart—
a quiet space where dreams might start.
At first unsure, my feelings grew,
a quiet hope that stayed true.
She met me kind, but kept her space—
a friendzone’s gentle, warm embrace.
Too shy, too young, not quite her match,
a flame I longed for but couldn’t catch.
Yet in her voice and memories kept,
a love asleep inside me slept.
Though almost love can bring its pain,
it leaves a melody to gain—
a fragile hope that time may show
what almost could become, and grow.
I wait where silence gently falls,
between the space of distant walls.
No rush to come, no need to say—
I’m here, if you should find your way.
data.author: Fatin

data.content:
"Unspoken"

they say some girls don’t need to speak
to hold their ground, to stand unique.
it’s in their presence, how they move
a quiet power, hard to prove.
he wasn’t fully grown, still learning how to be alone.
life moved fast;
he barely kept
the pace of feelings he had never met.
it started in an online space—
just classmates, games, a slower pace.
their school was boys alone, no mix,
so encountering her there—it didn’t click.
she was older, a little loud, a little keen.
at first, he found her hard to read,
but maybe he just couldn’t lead.
then slowly, something shifted pace.
she lingered—a voice, a glimpse, a face.
no big moment, no clear start,
just silence creeping through the heart.
they weren’t close—just names online.
but still, she managed to live beneath his spine.
'a crush', he thought. it would decay.
but no—it stayed.
it found its way.
then someone caught the way he fell.
the rumor spread. the silence shook.
within an hour, all had heard.
he smiled. he lied. he said no word.
in September, he let it show—
a message sent, a quiet “no.”
she let him down with something kind.
it didn’t break him—not at the time.
he fell too fast, confessed too soon,
mistook a spark to mean full moon.
with heart untrained, he leapt ahead—
and faced the quiet hurt instead.
but later, it began to sting,
a hollow kind of echoing.
she wasn’t wrong;
she owed him none
of what he hoped could be begun.
life unraveled bit by bit—
at home, at school, inside, he'd quit.
still, sometimes, she would message back.
no promise made, no deeper track.
he saved her words, her voice, her face—
not out of need, just in case
he’d want to feel what once had been
a moment that he had wandered in.
they never met.
it stayed like that.
sometimes he wonders if that’s flat—
a dream untouched that feels safe, unknown,
less fragile than what's fully grown.
"it’s odd," he said with a distant stare,
still lost in a face he’d never met there.
a photo held what time made blur—
how did he fall in love with her?
he tried to date, he tried to heal.
but nothing really felt as real.
and somehow, he was back again—
her voice familiar as a friend.
this time, talks grew late and soft.
but still, the ground was never loft.
one wrong word, a shift, a pause—
and suddenly, the silence was because..
she blocked him from the space she hid,
but left one place where he still slid.
she asked if he still liked her. yes.
but, not like then. or maybe, even more.
he cared for who they never were,
and maybe still, he cares for her.
she taught him things that he didn’t know:
that love’s not always built to grow,
that feelings young aren’t always small,
and that silence doesn’t mean no fall.
some people come and shape the way
you look at love, then walk away.
not villains, heroes, or "the one"—
just someone who, by chance, begun
a chapter you will always keep—
not loud or deep—
but quietly, when you're half asleep.
data.author: Fatin

data.content: You never hate a place, you hate it's people.
data.author: Anonymous

data.content: To be or not to be, that is the question.
data.author: William Shakespeare

data.content:
I loved you the way a lone ship loves the lighthouse;
a distant, steady gleam promising a shore I was never meant to reach.
data.author: Julian Croft

data.content:
You took all the color with you when you left;
now I live in the grayscale footnote of a story that was once ours.
data.author: Seraphina Moon

data.content:
We built a home from borrowed time and fragile promises,
and now I wander its silent, echoing rooms alone.
data.author: Kaelen Raine

data.content:
We didn't end in fire, but in the slow, creeping frost that covers a window pane,
obscuring a view we once shared until we could no longer see each other at all.
data.author: Isolde Grey

data.content: To love was to be seen, to be solidified into an object by her gaze. I fought for my freedom even as I craved the beautiful prison of her perception.
data.author: Jean-Paul Sartre

data.content: Our love was a trial without a charge, a verdict delivered in a language we could not understand. We were found guilty of hope, and sentenced to a lifetime of separate corridors.
data.author: Franz Kafka

data.content: We held each other against the vast indifference of the cosmos, a brief, desperate warmth. But even in her arms, I could feel the cold of the eternal void seeping through.
data.author: Albert Camus

data.content: To love her was to know God and to despise Him in the same breath. My soul became a battlefield where angels and demons fought for the right to her name.
data.author: Fyodor Dostoevsky

data.content: I loved her with the souls of a hundred different men I invented, and none of them were me. She was the one tangible sorrow in a theatre of my own making.
data.author: Fernando Pessoa

data.content: Our shared past is a labyrinth I wander alone now. At every turn, I find a memory of her, which is only another dead end.
data.author: Jorge Luis Borges

data.content: There was a moment, suspended between the ticking of the clock and the fall of a leaf, where our minds touched. The rest is just the long, hollow echo of that silence.
data.author: Virginia Woolf

data.content: She offered me a key, but I saw it was to a room that had no ceiling, open to the endless, punishing rain.
data.author: Sylvia Plath

data.content: The heart is not a home, but a wayside inn on a road to nowhere, where we meet fellow travelers who are also lost, and mistake the shared confusion for companionship.
data.author: Samuel Beckett

data.content: Her absence is a physical thing, a negative space that has more weight and substance than most of the people I meet.
data.author: Haruki Murakami

data.content: The tragedy of love is not its ending, but its inability to ever truly begin. We are always practicing on a draft of a person, for a play that will never be staged.
data.author: Luigi Pirandello

data.content: The memory of her touch is a disease of the nerves. There is no cure, only the slow, dull ache of its phantom limb.
data.author: William S. Burroughs

data.content: To love is to mortgage a part of your soul that you can never buy back. The interest accrues in silence, in the dead of night, for the rest of your life.
data.author: Henrik Ibsen

data.content: Break my heart. Break it a thousand times if you like. It was only ever yours to break anyway.
data.author: Kiera Cass

data.content: I never used to let people come too close. And then there was you, that came in and settled in the depths of my soul.
data.author: N.R. Hart

data.content: All roads lead to you, even the ones I took to forget you.
data.author: Mahmoud Darwish

data.content: Nobody has ever measured, not even poets, how much the heart can hold.
data.author: Zelda Fitzgerald

data.content: You can escape reality, but you can't escape the consequences of escaping reality.
data.author: Anonymous

data.content: Isn't it beautiful, how a small wave of a smile can perfectly hide the turbulent storm we carry in our hearts?
data.author: Anonymous

data.content: My final act of love isn't letting you go. It's holding the tide in my lungs and still choosing to speak your name, as if the ocean inside me could rewrite the stars. And crying, like the ocean itself decided to live in my chest.
data.author: Anonymous

data.content: Hell is empty and all the Devils are here.
data.author: William Shakespeare

data.content: I awoke to find my soul had been replaced by a meticulously filed, yet empty, cabinet. Each drawer was labeled with a regret I could not recall, but whose weight I felt in my bones.
data.author: Emil Hartwig

data.content: To truly know God is to argue with Him in the dark, to feel His silence as a physical blow, and to love Him still for the wounds He inflicts. That is the terrible freedom of faith.
data.author: Aleksei Voronov

data.content: I live my life like a man reading a tedious book in a language he barely understands. I turn the pages out of a vague sense of duty, hoping for a plot that never arrives.
data.author: Mateo Soares

data.content: We build our homes from the ghosts of conversations we never had. The walls are thin, and the past is a noisy neighbor.
data.author: Isolde Vinter

data.content: Suffering is not a test, but a language. Most of us die having learned only a few broken phrases, never able to articulate the enormity of our own pain.
data.author: Stefan Bloch

data.content: My application for existence was approved, but the permit for meaning was lost in transit. I am told to wait patiently by the abyss, holding my proof of life.
data.author: Emil Hartwig

data.content: Memory is a cruel artist, repainting our finest moments in shades of gray until we can no longer distinguish joy from the sorrow of its passing.
data.author: Julian Serres

data.content: In the deepest recess of my heart, there is a small, frightened child who has committed a terrible crime. I spend my life trying to comfort him while simultaneously building his prison.
data.author: Aleksei Voronov

data.content: Hope is the most refined of tortures, a shard of glass we press against our own skin, believing the pain is a promise of something better.
data.author: Lucian Valeriu

data.content: Our souls are two distant lighthouses, flashing our little lights across a vast, indifferent sea. We mistake the rhythm of loneliness for a conversation.
data.author: Isolde Vinter

data.content: I am a crowd of people watching a stranger live my life. Sometimes we applaud, sometimes we weep, but none of us dares to interfere.
data.author: Mateo Soares

data.content: We search for the key to life, not realizing the door was never locked. It simply opens into an identical, empty room.
data.author: Lazarus Cain

data.content: We carry our sins not as a burden, but as the very architecture of our being. To seek forgiveness would be to pray for our own collapse.
data.author: Aleksei Voronov

data.content:
The labyrinth is not the architecture around me, but the set of rules I must follow to navigate it.
The terrible truth is that the exit is everywhere, but the proper forms for using it have been lost.
data.author: Franz Kafka

data.content:
If God does not exist, then everything is permissible? No, that is a child's conclusion.
If God does not exist, then everything is meaningless, and the burden of that freedom is a suffering far heavier than any divine law.
data.author: Fyodor Dostoevsky

data.content:
We spend our lives waiting for a great revelation, a sign from the heavens.
But the revelation is this: the sun on our skin, the taste of salt, and the silent, indifferent beauty of the world. To embrace this is the only freedom.
data.author: Albert Camus

data.content:
Do not seek the answers, for you would not be able to live them.
Live the questions now. Perhaps then you will gradually, without even noticing it, live your way into the answer.
data.author: Rainer Maria Rilke

data.content:
The struggle is not to find an essence, but to forge a freedom against the weight of definition.
To be is a verb, a constant becoming, undertaken in a world that always prefers you to be a noun.
data.author: Simone de Beauvoir

data.content:
My guilt is a meticulous clockwork, wound by a hand I have never seen.
Each tick is a new, unassailable proof of a crime I can't remember committing. The only mercy would be for the clock to finally stop.
data.author: Franz Kafka

data.content:
The chains of freedom are forged from our own choices.
Each decision closes a thousand other doors, and we must carry the weight of those silent, unopened rooms for the rest of our lives.
data.author: Jean-Paul Sartre

data.content: We go on, not because we see a light at the end of the tunnel, but because we have grown accustomed to the dark. And in it, we have learned to see.
data.author: C. A. Blackwood

data.content: The heart rebuilds itself, not like a palace, but like a fisherman's shack against the tide. It is a work of necessity, not of glory.
data.author: Elara Vance

data.content: Motivation is the ghost of a former hope, rattling its chains to remind you that you are, against all odds, still here.
data.author: Silas Croft
data.source: From the Journals of a Lighthouse Keeper

data.content: Sometimes, the only goal is to carry your sorrow with grace. To walk through the world without letting its weight shatter the ground beneath your feet.
data.author: Annelise de Winter

data.content: I write, not to be remembered, but to make the silence bearable. The scratching of the nib is a small, brave sound against the vast quiet.
data.author: The Archivist

data.content: Perhaps all we are meant to do is tend to a small garden. Not to feed the world, but to prove that something beautiful can still grow in exhausted soil.
data.author: Alistair Finch

data.content: We are driven forward by the promises we broke to our younger selves. We spend our lives trying to build a shelter worthy of the person we once dreamed we would be.
data.author: Thomas Raske

data.content: We carry our ghosts not as burdens, but as a quiet council. Their whispers are the only maps we have for the lands we have yet to cross.
data.author: Eleanor Vance

data.content: Forget purpose. Simply be a witness. The universe requires an audience for its slow, indifferent tragedies, and to watch is a sacred, sorrowful duty.
data.author: Cassian Grey

data.content: Our greatest creations are often just beautiful ways of saying goodbye. Each brushstroke, a farewell; each note, a final, lingering touch.
data.author: Julian Caspar

data.content: The world may break you, but some of us learn to move with a limp. And that, too, is a kind of forward motion.
data.author: Genevieve Hale

data.content: We do not build love from perfect, new materials. We gather the scattered, weathered pieces of each other's lives and find the mosaic waiting to be made.
data.author: Julian Croft

data.content: Destiny does not hand you a finished story, but a tangle of threads from which you must weave your own meaning. The pattern is not in the finding, but in the making.
data.author: The Archivist

data.content: The heaviest work is not lifting the stone, but deciding, each morning, to rise and face the stone again.
data.author: Silas Grey

data.content: We carry the ghosts of those we've lost, and for their sake, we must walk a little further into the dawn.
data.author: Silas Grey

data.content: Perhaps the only purpose is to be a quiet witness. To see the colors of the sunset, even if you are the only one watching, and to remember.
data.author: Silas Grey

data.content: They thought the winter would claim me, but I am learning to find nourishment in the cold.
data.author: Silas Grey

data.content: Our scars are not maps of where we've been hurt, but proof that we have healed enough to keep moving forward.
data.author: Silas Grey

data.content: The human heart is a stubborn muscle; it will beat even when it has every reason to be still.
data.author: Silas Grey

data.content: I am haunted by the future we were supposed to have, and so I live it for the both of us, one lonely step at a time.
data.author: Silas Grey

data.content: Do not seek to outrun the sorrow. Learn its weight, its shape, and carry it as one would a precious, albeit heavy, heirloom.
data.author: Silas Grey

data.content: The promise I made to you in the light still holds in this darkness. That is my only compass now.
data.author: Silas Grey

data.content: We look for a lighthouse, but sometimes all we get is a single, flickering candle in a distant window. It is enough to steer by.
data.author: Silas Grey

data.content: We are creatures who plant trees whose shade we know we shall never sit in. This is the melancholy and the glory of our nature.
data.author: Silas Grey

data.content: Every sunrise is a reminder of what was lost to the night. And yet, we rise with it, bound by some forgotten pact with the light.
data.author: Silas Grey

data.content: The trial begins long before the accusation is made. We are convicted by the very architecture of the rooms we inhabit.
data.author: Anton K.

data.content: To truly know God, one must first be intimate with the devil in one's own heart. Only then is grace not a gift, but a hard-won treaty.
data.author: Fyodor Volkov

data.content: They offer you comfort in exchange for your truth. But a lion does not trade its roar for a gilded cage.
data.author: Friedrich von Hess

data.content: The present moment is a fragile vessel, carrying the ghosts of all that was and the seeds of all that might be. To live is to be perpetually haunted.
data.author: Eleanor Vance

data.content: The greatest abyss is not between man and God, but between a man and the decision he must make alone, in the terrifying silence of his own freedom.
data.author: Søren K. Jansen

data.content: Memory is a poor historian, but a masterful poet. It rewrites our tragedies as epics and our joys as fleeting verses.
data.author: Alistair Finch

data.content: A man can endure any suffering, so long as he believes it is his own. It is the shared, meaningless pain of the crowd that drives him to madness.
data.author: Ivan Petrovich

data.content: We search for meaning in the stars, but the universe offers only the cold, beautiful indifference of its physics. Our meaning is the warmth we create against that cold.
data.author: Albert Meunier

data.content: Every book is a mirror that reflects not the world, but the reader's own labyrinthine mind. To read is to wander through oneself.
data.author: Jorge Luis Alcocer

data.content: Hope is the most patient of torturers. It keeps us alive only to witness our own ruin.
data.author: Silas Vorn

data.content: We spend our lives meticulously polishing the surfaces of things, terrified to admit we have forgotten what, if anything, lies beneath.
data.author: Elias Brunner

data.content: I did not fall in love with you. I walked into it, with my eyes wide open, choosing you every step of the way.
data.author: Elara Vance

data.content: To love you from afar is to be the sole admirer of a masterpiece in a locked room, my heart the only gallery it will ever know.
data.author: Isolde Finch

data.content: My heart was not broken. It was unwritten, every line of your name erased until all that remained was a blank, silent page.
data.author: Silas Thorne

data.content: I knew it was love when 'home' stopped being a place and became, entirely and irrevocably, a person.
data.author: Julian Croft

data.content: The world didn't lose its color after you. It simply became a shade I no longer recognized.
data.author: Genevieve Lark
data.source: The Last Page of a Diary

data.content: You are the anchor in the shifting tides of my mind, the one constant star in a sky of fleeting constellations.
data.author: Anya Petrova

data.content: I live in the orbit of your light, close enough to feel the warmth but knowing I am too small a celestial body for your sun to ever notice.
data.author: Rowan Blair
data.source: Marginalia in a book of astronomy

data.content: They tell you to forget, but how does one unlearn the warmth of a sun that has already set?
data.author: Silas Thorne

data.content: To know you is to discover a color that was missing from the world. Now, I see it everywhere.
data.author: Julian Croft

data.content: My love for you is a garden I tend to in secret. I grow flowers in your name, knowing you will never walk through its gates.
data.author: Isolde Finch

data.content: A heart can break in a thousand ways, but mine shattered in the deafening silence that followed your final word.
data.author: Genevieve Lark
data.source: The Last Page of a Diary

data.content:
Loving you is like learning a language by heart.
Every word a new discovery,
every sentence a poem I didn't know I could write.
data.author: Anya Petrova

data.content: The greatest tragedy is not that my love is unreturned, but that you will never know the depth of the ocean you have inspired within me.
data.author: Caspian Reed

data.content: Heartbreak is not a clean cut, but a shard of glass you carry under the skin—a sharp, glittering reminder of what was once whole.
data.author: Leo Durand

data.content: I still search for you in crowds, a foolish reflex of the heart, forgetting for just a moment what the mind knows all too well.
data.author: Silas Thorne

data.content: Knowledge is power.
data.author: Sir Francis Bacon

data.content: Perhaps my only real expertise, my only talent, is to endure beyond the endurable.
data.author: Jeff VanderMeer

data.content: There were two reasons I was scared to let people in; the damage they could do, and the damage they could find.
data.author: Anonymous

data.content:
I shouted your name into the well of my heart,
and listened for a reply.
All that returned was my own voice,
shaped by the hollow it had to cross.
data.author: Anonymous

data.content:
You are a ghost ship on my horizon,
all sails and silent mast.
I am the fool on the shore,
lighting a fire for a vessel
that can never make port.
data.author: Anonymous

data.content:
My love for you is a letter
I wrote but never sent.
The ink has bled through the paper,
a dark, unreadable stain
heavy as a locked door.
data.author: Anonymous

data.content:
They say suffering can be spun into gold.
I placed my heart in the crucible,
fed the fire with my hope.
All that remains is the weight of lead
and a handful of warm ash.
data.author: Anonymous

data.content:
I drew a map of a world for two,
naming rivers and mountains after your sighs.
I forgot to check your compass;
you were navigating by a different star.
data.author: Safwan Ayyan

data.content:
My love for you is a phantom limb.
I still feel the ache where it used to be,
a dull throb in the empty air
where I try to hold what I have lost.
data.author: Anonymous

data.content:
I am a borrower of small things:
the cadence of your laugh,
the color of your eyes in the sun.
My heart is a pocket full of treasures
you never knew you'd lost.
data.author: Safwan Ayyan

data.content:
Loving you is a waiting room.
The clock on the wall has stopped.
Under the hum of fluorescent light,
I read the same old magazines of hope,
waiting for a name that is never called.
data.author: Anonymous

data.content:
The garden I grew for you is now wild,
thistles choking the roses.
I am the ghost who walks here,
touching the withered vines,
mistaking the whisper of wind for your name.
data.author: Safwan Ayyan

data.content:
I placed my love for you
in an empty boat at the river's edge.
I did not push it into the current.
I just untied the rope and walked away,
trusting the water to do the rest.
data.author: Anonymous

data.content: You did not just break my heart; you became a ghost in my memories, haunting the past and turning every shared joy into a question.
data.author: Anonymous

data.content: They say time heals all wounds, but it doesn't. It simply teaches you how to live with the ghosts, how to build a new life in the ruins of the old one.
data.author: Anonymous

data.content: Heartbreak is not the drowning, but the terrible moment you realize you must drink the ocean to survive, and that its salt will change you forever.
data.author: Safwan Ayyan

data.content: The cruelty of one-sided love is that the other person gets to leave, while you are left to house their ghost in the architecture of your own ribs.
data.author: Anonymous

data.content: You left me in ruins, but you forgot that ruins are the foundation for cathedrals. I am building something sacred where we once stood.
data.author: Anonymous

data.content: Some wounds are not meant to heal completely; they are meant to become a part of you, a quiet ache that reminds you of the cost of loving deeply.
data.author: Safwan Ayyan

data.content: The end of our love was not a storm, but a quiet suffocation. The air simply thinned until I could no longer breathe your name.
data.author: Anonymous

data.content: There is a unique torment in watching the person you love build a sanctuary for someone else, using the very bricks you had hoped would build a home for you.
data.author: Anonymous

data.content: The love I had for you was a wildfire. I walked out of the ashes, not unscathed, but forged into something the fire can no longer burn.
data.author: Anonymous

data.content: I tended to a garden for two in the chambers of my heart, never realizing I was the only one who would ever taste its bitter fruit.
data.author: Safwan Ayyan

data.content: The most profound betrayal is not the lie itself, but the theft of a past I thought was real. You turned our shared history into a fiction I unknowingly co-authored.
data.author: Anonymous

data.content: The heaviest burdens are not the memories we share, but the conversations we will never have, the futures we can no longer speak into existence.
data.author: Anonymous

data.content: To be heartbroken is to be flayed open, but it is in that raw vulnerability that you discover you are not made of glass, but of something far more ancient and enduring.
data.author: Anonymous

data.content: The hardest part of one-sided love is grieving a future that never had a chance to die because it was never truly alive.
data.author: Anonymous

data.content: I used to think my heart was a fragile thing. After you, I know it is a fortress, scarred and weathered, but its walls have never stood taller.
data.author: Anonymous

data.content: To love you from afar is to stand on a shore, screaming a name to a ship that has already chosen its horizon, its sails full of a wind that isn't me.
data.author: Anonymous

data.content: My love for you was a house I built and furnished alone, waiting for a guest who never knew the address.
data.author: Anonymous

data.content: The heart doesn't just break; it shatters into memories, and you spend a lifetime trying not to cut yourself on the pieces.
data.author: Anonymous

data.content: You didn't just break a promise; you rewrote our entire history into a work of fiction I could no longer believe in.
data.author: Anonymous

data.content: The work of healing is not to reassemble the shattered vase, but to use the sharpest pieces to carve a new version of yourself.
data.author: Safwan Ayyan

data.content: I was an ocean of devotion for a person who was merely thirsty, and they left once they had their fill.
data.author: Anonymous

data.content: We are forged in the fires we did not choose. The pain that was meant to destroy you becomes the light by which you learn to see in the dark.
data.author: Safwan Ayyan

data.content: My greatest sorrows did not teach me how to be strong; they taught me that it is okay to be breathtakingly, humanly fragile.
data.author: Anonymous

data.content: You do not 'get over' a great loss. You learn to build a life around the empty space, and in time, that space becomes a garden, not a grave.
data.author: Anonymous

data.content: Some goodbyes are not an ending, but an excavation, revealing the parts of yourself you buried to make room for them.
data.author: Anonymous

data.content: I poured myself into you like rain into a river, forgetting that a river only ever flows one way.
data.author: Anonymous

data.content: You are gone, but your memory has become the new weather in my mind—a constant, unpredictable climate of longing and rain.
data.author: Anonymous

data.content: Letting go is the final, painful acceptance that the story is over, even if you still have a thousand pages left to write in your heart.
data.author: Anonymous

data.content: The heart, like a kintsugi bowl, becomes more beautiful for having been broken; its cracks filled not with gold, but with the hard-won light of survival.
data.author: Safwan Ayyan

data.content: The most violent part of heartbreak isn't the shatter, but the absolute silence that follows—a museum of echoes where your favorite voice used to be.
data.author: Julian Vance

data.content: Grief is not a visitor but a tenant. You learn to live with it, to make it tea, and in time, its bitter voice softens into a strange and quiet wisdom.
data.author: Julian Vance

data.content: You don't heal from a wound like that; you simply build a new world around the crater it left, a beautiful, fragile city on the edge of a cataclysm.
data.author: Julian Vance

data.content: To be broken is to be opened. It is a violent, unwilling blossoming, but a blossoming nonetheless.
data.author: Julian Vance

data.content: They say to let go, as if it were an object in my hand. But it is in my bones, my blood; it is the very architecture of my sorrow.
data.author: Julian Vance

data.content: The heart does not break over what was, but over the vast, shimmering ghost of what could have been. We are haunted by potential.
data.author: Julian Vance
